main event: A glowing white ball surrounded by flames was observed falling from the sky southwest of Nogales, Arizona on May 22, 1958.
interesting points: The object fell from the sky and looked like a meteor.
The object landed about 10 miles southwest of the observer.
The object was described as a brilliant white ball surrounded by flames.
The observer was traveling with his wife and daughter to Nogales when they witnessed the event.
The observer reported the incident and offered to provide more information to aid the investigation.
sighted object: a glowing white ball surrounded by flames
witnesses: a man traveling with his wife and daughter
